subject: AI & Agents
title: The EU AI Act: First Rules for AI
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The EU AI Act: First Rules for AI.

hook.text: In 2024, the EU passed the world's first comprehensive AI law. It bans some uses outright.

buildup.text: The AI Act classifies systems by risk: unacceptable, high, limited, and minimal.

discovery.text: Social scoring and real-time facial recognition in public are banned. High-risk AI needs audits.

twist.text: Critics say the law is too complex and could stifle European AI innovation compared to the US and China.

climax.text: Companies worldwide must comply if they serve EU customers, making this a de facto global standard.

punchline.text: Europe drew the first lines. Now the world decides whether to follow.

quiz.question: What does the EU AI Act ban outright?
options: Social scoring and real-time public facial recognition
All use of AI in business
